p: Dengue is the most important arboviral disease in the country and the most widely reported. According to the Brazilian Ministry of Health, a total of 1,455,898 probable dengue cases have been reported in the country from January to September 2019 [ 7]. The disease is caused by Dengue virus (DENV) (genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae), which has four serotypes, characterized by four to six genotypes: DENV-1 (genotypes I, II, III, IV, V, and VI) [ 8, 9], DENV-2 (Asian/American, Asian 1, Asian 2, Cosmopolitan, and American genotypes) [ 10], DENV-3 (genotypes Iâ€“V) [ 11], and DENV-4 (genotypes I, IIA, IIB, III, IV [sylvatic], and V) [ 12].
